issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares Stock.add(String) should return void, but both the template and solution implementations have Stock.add(String) returning int. This mismatch between the specified signature and the provided code can confuse students when they try to implement or use the method according to the UML.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the UML in the problem statement to show add(String): int, or change the Stock.add method signature in the template to return void to align with the UML.
